PdfFormField isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><b class="descfrmTypeLabel">Description copied from class:&nbsp;<code>PdfObjectWrapper</code></b><br>Defines if the object behind this wrapper must be an indirect object in the resultant document. <br><br> If this method returns <i>true</i> it doesn't necessarily mean that object must be in the indirect state at any moment, but rather defines that when the object will be written to the document it will be transformed into indirect object if it's not indirect yet. <br><br> Return value of this method shouldn't depend on any logic, it should return always <i>true</i> or <i>false</i>.</br></br></br></br><pre>protected boolean isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect()</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/forms/fields/PdfFormField.html#isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect--

PdfFormXObject flush	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>To manually flush a <code>PdfObject</code> behind this wrapper, you have to ensure that this object is added to the document, i.e. it has an indirect reference. Basically this means that before flushing you need to explicitly call <code>PdfObjectWrapper.makeIndirect(PdfDocument)</code>. For example: wrapperInstance.makeIndirect(document).flush(); Note that not every wrapper require this, only those that have such warning in documentation.<pre>public void flush()</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/xobject/PdfFormXObject.html#flush--

PdfFunction flush	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>To manually flush a <code>PdfObject</code> behind this wrapper, you have to ensure that this object is added to the document, i.e. it has an indirect reference. Basically this means that before flushing you need to explicitly call <code>PdfObjectWrapper.makeIndirect(PdfDocument)</code>. For example: wrapperInstance.makeIndirect(document).flush(); Note that not every wrapper require this, only those that have such warning in documentation.<pre>public void flush()</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/function/PdfFunction.html#flush--
PdfFunction isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><b class="descfrmTypeLabel">Description copied from class:&nbsp;<code>PdfObjectWrapper</code></b><br>Defines if the object behind this wrapper must be an indirect object in the resultant document. <br><br> If this method returns <i>true</i> it doesn't necessarily mean that object must be in the indirect state at any moment, but rather defines that when the object will be written to the document it will be transformed into indirect object if it's not indirect yet. <br><br> Return value of this method shouldn't depend on any logic, it should return always <i>true</i> or <i>false</i>.</br></br></br></br><pre>protected boolean isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect()</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/function/PdfFunction.html#isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect--

PdfImageXObject identifyImageType	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Identifies the type of the image that is stored in the bytes of this <code>PdfImageXObject</code>. Note that this has nothing to do with the original type of the image. For instance, the return value of this method will never be <code>ImageType.PNG</code> as we loose this information when converting a PNG image into something that can be put into a PDF file. The possible values are: <code>ImageType.JPEG</code>, <code>ImageType.JPEG2000</code>, <code>ImageType.JBIG2</code>, <code>ImageType.TIFF</code>, <code>ImageType.PNG</code><pre>public ImageType identifyImageType()</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/xobject/PdfImageXObject.html#identifyImageType--

PdfLayer isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><b class="descfrmTypeLabel">Description copied from class:&nbsp;<code>PdfObjectWrapper</code></b><br>Defines if the object behind this wrapper must be an indirect object in the resultant document. <br><br> If this method returns <i>true</i> it doesn't necessarily mean that object must be in the indirect state at any moment, but rather defines that when the object will be written to the document it will be transformed into indirect object if it's not indirect yet. <br><br> Return value of this method shouldn't depend on any logic, it should return always <i>true</i> or <i>false</i>.</br></br></br></br><pre>protected boolean isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect()</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/layer/PdfLayer.html#isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect--

PdfLayerMembership	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Content typically belongs to a single optional content group, and is visible when the group is ON and invisible when it is OFF. To express more complex visibility policies, content should not declare itself to belong to an optional content group directly, but rather to an optional content membership dictionary represented by this class.  To be able to be wrapped with this PdfObjectWrapper the PdfObject must be indirect.</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/layer/PdfLayerMembership.html

PdfLayerMembership setVisibilityPolicy	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Sets the visibility policy for content belonging to this membership dictionary. Possible values are AllOn, AnyOn, AnyOff and AllOff. AllOn - Visible only if all of the entries are <b>ON</b>. AnyOn - Visible if any of the entries are <b>ON</b>. AnyOff - Visible if any of the entries are <b>OFF</b>. AllOff - Visible only if all of the entries are <b>OFF</b>. The default value is AnyOn.<pre>public void setVisibilityPolicy(PdfName visibilityPolicy)</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/layer/PdfLayerMembership.html#setVisibilityPolicy-com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.PdfName-

PdfLineAnnotation	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The purpose of a line annotation is to display a single straight line on the page. When opened, it displays a pop-up window containing the text of the associated note. See also ISO-320001 12.5.6.7 "Line Annotations".</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfLineAnnotation.html
PdfLineAnnotation getSubtype	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Gets a <code>PdfName</code> which value is a subtype of this annotation. See ISO-320001 12.5.6, &acirc;Annotation Types&acirc; for the reference to the possible types.<pre>public PdfName getSubtype()</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfLineAnnotation.html#getSubtype--
PdfLineAnnotation getLine	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>An array of four numbers, [x1 y1 x2 y2], specifying the starting and ending coordinates of the line in default user space. If the <code>PdfName.LL</code> (see <code>getLeaderLine()</code>) entry is present, this value represents the endpoints of the leader lines rather than the endpoints of the line itself.<pre>public PdfArray getLine()</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfLineAnnotation.html#getLine--
PdfLineAnnotation getLineEndingStyles	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>An array of two names specifying the line ending styles that is used in drawing the line. The first and second elements of the array shall specify the line ending styles for the endpoints defined, respectively, by the first and second pairs of coordinates, (x1, y1) and (x2, y2), in the <code>PdfName.L</code> array (see <code>getLine()</code>. For possible values see <code>setLineEndingStyles(PdfArray)</code>.<pre>public PdfArray getLineEndingStyles()</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfLineAnnotation.html#getLineEndingStyles--
PdfLineAnnotation setLineEndingStyles	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Sets the line ending styles that are used in drawing the line. The first and second elements of the array shall specify the line ending styles for the endpoints defined, respectively, by the first and second pairs of coordinates, (x1, y1) and (x2, y2), in the <code>PdfName.L</code> array (see <code>getLine()</code>. Possible values for styles are: <ul><li><code>PdfName.Square</code> - A square filled with the annotation's interior color, if any; </li><li><code>PdfName.Circle</code> - A circle filled with the annotation's interior color, if any; </li><li><code>PdfName.Diamond</code> - A diamond shape filled with the annotation's interior color, if any; </li><li><code>PdfName.OpenArrow</code> - Two short lines meeting in an acute angle to form an open arrowhead; </li><li><code>PdfName.ClosedArrow</code> - Two short lines meeting in an acute angle as in the <code>PdfName.OpenArrow</code> style and     connected by a third line to form a triangular closed arrowhead filled with the annotation's interior color, if any; </li><li><code>PdfName.None</code> - No line ending; </li><li><code>PdfName.Butt</code> - A short line at the endpoint perpendicular to the line itself; </li><li><code>PdfName.ROpenArrow</code> - Two short lines in the reverse direction from <code>PdfName.OpenArrow</code>; </li><li><code>PdfName.RClosedArrow</code> - A triangular closed arrowhead in the reverse direction from <code>PdfName.ClosedArrow</code>; </li><li><code>PdfName.Slash</code> - A short line at the endpoint approximately 30 degrees clockwise from perpendicular to the line itself; </li></ul> see also ISO-320001, Table 176 "Line ending styles".<pre>public PdfLineAnnotation setLineEndingStyles(PdfArray lineEndingStyles)</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfLineAnnotation.html#setLineEndingStyles-com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.PdfArray-
PdfLineAnnotation getLeaderLine	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><span class="deprecatedLabel">Deprecated.</span>&nbsp;<span class="deprecationComment">use <code>getLeaderLineLength()</code> instead.</span><br>The length of leader lines in default user space that extend from each endpoint of the line perpendicular to the line itself. A positive value means that the leader lines appear in the direction that is clockwise when traversing the line from its starting point to its ending point (as specified by <code>PdfName.L</code> (see <code>getLine()</code>); a negative value indicates the opposite direction.<pre>@Deprecatedpublic float getLeaderLine()</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfLineAnnotation.html#getLeaderLine--

A positive value means that the leader lines appear in the direction that is clockwise when traversing the line from its starting point to its ending point (as specified by <code>PdfName.L</code> (see <code>getLine()</code>); a negative value indicates the opposite direction.<pre>@Deprecatedpublic PdfLineAnnotation setLeaderLine(float leaderLine)</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfLineAnnotation.html#setLeaderLine-float-

PdfLineAnnotation getCaptionOffset	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>An array of two numbers that specifies the offset of the caption text from its normal position. PdfMarkupAnnotation	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>This is a super class for the annotations which are defined as markup annotations because they are used primarily to mark up PDF documents. These annotations have text that appears as part of the annotation and may be displayed in other ways by a conforming reader, such as in a Comments pane. See also ISO-320001 12.5.6.2 "Markup Annotations".</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfMarkupAnnotation.html

Valid values are: <ul><li><code>PdfName.R</code> - The annotation shall be considered a reply to the annotation specified by IRT. PdfMarkupAnnotation setIntent	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Sets a name describing the intent of the markup annotation. Intents allow conforming readers to distinguish between different uses and behaviors of a single markup annotation type. If this entry is not present or its value is the same as the annotation type, the annotation shall have no explicit intent and should behave in a generic manner in a conforming reader. <p> See ISO-320001, free text annotations (Table 174), line annotations (Table 175), polygon annotations (Table 178), and polyline annotations (Table 178) for the specific intent values for those types. </p><pre>public PdfMarkupAnnotation setIntent(PdfName intent)</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfMarkupAnnotation.html#setIntent-com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.PdfName-
PdfMarkupAnnotation getExternalData	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>An external data dictionary specifying data that shall be associated with the annotation. This dictionary contains the following entries: <ul><li><code>PdfName.Type</code> - (optional) If present, shall be <code>PdfName.ExData</code>.</li><li><code>PdfName.Subtype</code> - (required) a name specifying the type of data that the markup annotation     shall be associated with. The only defined value is <code>PdfName.Markup3D</code>. Table 298 (ISO-320001)     lists the values that correspond to a subtype of Markup3D (See also <code>Pdf3DAnnotation</code>).</li></ul><pre>public PdfDictionary getExternalData()</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfMarkupAnnotation.html#getExternalData--

PdfMarkupAnnotation setRectangleDifferences	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>A set of four numbers describing the numerical differences between two rectangles: the Rect entry of the annotation and another rectangle within that one, which meaning depends on the type of the annotation: <ul><li> for <code>PdfFreeTextAnnotation</code> the inner rectangle is where the annotation's text should be displayed;</li><li>         for <code>PdfSquareAnnotation</code> and <code>PdfCircleAnnotation</code> the inner rectangle is the actual boundaries         of the underlying square or circle;     </li><li> for <code>PdfCaretAnnotation</code> the inner rectangle is the actual boundaries of the underlying caret.</li></ul><pre>public PdfMarkupAnnotation setRectangleDifferences(PdfArray rect)</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfMarkupAnnotation.html#setRectangleDifferences-com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.PdfArray-

PdfMcr isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><b class="descfrmTypeLabel">Description copied from class:&nbsp;<code>PdfObjectWrapper</code></b><br>Defines if the object behind this wrapper must be an indirect object in the resultant document. <br><br> If this method returns <i>true</i> it doesn't necessarily mean that object must be in the indirect state at any moment, but rather defines that when the object will be written to the document it will be transformed into indirect object if it's not indirect yet. <br><br> Return value of this method shouldn't depend on any logic, it should return always <i>true</i> or <i>false</i>.</br></br></br></br><pre>protected boolean isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect()</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/tagging/PdfMcr.html#isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect--

PdfMediaClipData	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>This class is a wrapper of media clip data dictionary that defines the data for a media object that can be played.</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/action/PdfMediaClipData.html
PdfMediaClipData flush	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>To manually flush a <code>PdfObject</code> behind this wrapper, you have to ensure that this object is added to the document, i.e. it has an indirect reference. Basically this means that before flushing you need to explicitly call <code>PdfObjectWrapper.makeIndirect(PdfDocument)</code>. For example: wrapperInstance.makeIndirect(document).flush(); Note that not every wrapper require this, only those that have such warning in documentation.<pre>public void flush()</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/action/PdfMediaClipData.html#flush--
PdfMediaClipData isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Defines if the object behind this wrapper must be an indirect object in the resultant document. <br><br> If this method returns <i>true</i> it doesn't necessarily mean that object must be in the indirect state at any moment, but rather defines that when the object will be written to the document it will be transformed into indirect object if it's not indirect yet. <br><br> Return value of this method shouldn't depend on any logic, it should return always <i>true</i> or <i>false</i>.</br></br></br></br><pre>protected boolean isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect()</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/action/PdfMediaClipData.html#isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect--
PdfMerger setCloseSourceDocuments	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>If set to <i>true</i> then passed to the <i><code>PdfMerger#merge</code></i> method source documents will be closed immediately after merging specified pages into current document. If <i>false</i> - PdfDocuments are left open. Default value - <i>false</i>.<pre>public PdfMerger setCloseSourceDocuments(boolean closeSourceDocuments)</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/utils/PdfMerger.html#setCloseSourceDocuments-boolean-
PdfMerger merge	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>This method merges pages from the source document to the current one. <br/><br/> If <i>closeSourceDocuments</i> flag is set to <i>true</i> (see <code>setCloseSourceDocuments(boolean)</code>), passed <code>PdfDocument</code> will be closed after pages are merged.<pre>public PdfMerger merge(PdfDocument from, List&lt;Integer&gt; pages)</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/utils/PdfMerger.html#merge-com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.PdfDocument-java.util.List-
PdfMerger close	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Closes the current document. It is a complete equivalent of calling <code>PdfDocument#close</code> on the PdfDocument passed to the constructor of this PdfMerger instance. This means that it is enough to call <i>close</i> either on passed PdfDocument or on this PdfMerger instance, but there is no need to call them both.<pre>public void close()</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/utils/PdfMerger.html#close--

PdfObjectWrapper isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Defines if the object behind this wrapper must be an indirect object in the resultant document. <br><br> If this method returns <i>true</i> it doesn't necessarily mean that object must be in the indirect state at any moment, but rather defines that when the object will be written to the document it will be transformed into indirect object if it's not indirect yet. <br><br> Return value of this method shouldn't depend on any logic, it should return always <i>true</i> or <i>false</i>.</br></br></br></br><pre>protected abstract boolean isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect()</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfObjectWrapper.html#isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect--

PdfObjectWrapper ensureObjectIsAddedToDocument	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Some wrappers use object's indirect reference to obtain the <code>PdfDocument</code> to which the object belongs to. For this matter, for these wrappers it is implicitly defined that they work with indirect objects only. Commonly these wrappers have two constructors: one with <code>PdfDocument</code> as parameter to create a new object, and the other one which wraps around the given <code>PdfObject</code>. This method should be used in the second type of constructors to ensure that wrapper will able to obtain the <code>PdfDocument</code> instance.<pre>protected static void ensureObjectIsAddedToDocument(PdfObject object)</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfObjectWrapper.html#markObjectAsIndirect-com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.PdfObject-

PdfPage getResources	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Gets the <code>PdfResources</code> wrapper object for this page resources. If page doesn't have resource object, then it will be inherited from page's parents. If neither parents nor page has the resource object, then the new one is created and added to page dictionary. <br/><br/> NOTE: If you'll try to modify the inherited resources, then the new resources object will be created, so you won't change the parent's resources. This new object under the wrapper will be added to page dictionary on <code>flush()</code>, or you can add it manually with this line, if needed:<br/><code>getPdfObject().put(PdfName.Resources, getResources().getPdfObject());</code><pre>public PdfResources getResources()</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfPage.html#getResources--

PdfPage flush	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Flushes page and it's content stream. <br><br> If the page belongs to the document which is tagged, page flushing also triggers flushing of the tags, which are considered to belong to the page. The logic that defines if the given tag (structure element) belongs to the page is the following: if all the marked content references (dictionary or number references), that are the descenders of the given structure element, belong to the current page - the tag is considered to belong to the page. If tag has descenders from several pages - it is flushed, if all other pages except the current one are flushed.</br></br><pre>public void flush()</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfPage.html#flush--

PdfPage isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><b class="descfrmTypeLabel">Description copied from class:&nbsp;<code>PdfObjectWrapper</code></b><br>Defines if the object behind this wrapper must be an indirect object in the resultant document. <br><br> If this method returns <i>true</i> it doesn't necessarily mean that object must be in the indirect state at any moment, but rather defines that when the object will be written to the document it will be transformed into indirect object if it's not indirect yet. <br><br> Return value of this method shouldn't depend on any logic, it should return always <i>true</i> or <i>false</i>.</br></br></br></br><pre>protected boolean isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect()</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfPage.html#isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect--

PdfPattern flush	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>To manually flush a <code>PdfObject</code> behind this wrapper, you have to ensure that this object is added to the document, i.e. it has an indirect reference. Basically this means that before flushing you need to explicitly call <code>PdfObjectWrapper.makeIndirect(PdfDocument)</code>. For example: wrapperInstance.makeIndirect(document).flush(); Note that not every wrapper require this, only those that have such warning in documentation.<pre>public void flush()</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/colorspace/PdfPattern.html#flush--

PdfPKCS7 getEncodedPKCS7	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Gets the bytes for the PKCS7SignedData object. Optionally the authenticatedAttributes in the signerInfo can also be set, OR a time-stamp-authority client may be provided.<pre>public byte[] getEncodedPKCS7(byte[] secondDigest, ITSAClient tsaClient, byte[] ocsp, Collection&lt;byte[]&gt; crlBytes, PdfSigner.CryptoStandard sigtype)</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/signatures/PdfPKCS7.html#getEncodedPKCS7-byte:A-com.itextpdf.signatures.ITSAClient-byte:A-java.util.Collection-com.itextpdf.signatures.PdfSigner.CryptoStandard-
PdfPKCS7 getAuthenticatedAttributeBytes	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>When using authenticatedAttributes the authentication process is different. The document digest is generated and put inside the attribute. The signing is done over the DER encoded authenticatedAttributes. This method provides that encoding and the parameters must be exactly the same as in <code>getEncodedPKCS7(byte[])</code>. <p> A simple example: <p><pre> Calendar cal = Calendar.getInstance(); PdfPKCS7 pk7 = new PdfPKCS7(key, chain, null, "SHA1", null, false); MessageDigest messageDigest = MessageDigest.getInstance("SHA1"); byte[] buf = new byte[8192]; int n; InputStream inp = sap.getRangeStream(); while ((n = inp.read(buf)) &gt; 0) {    messageDigest.update(buf, 0, n); } byte[] hash = messageDigest.digest(); byte[] sh = pk7.getAuthenticatedAttributeBytes(hash, cal); pk7.update(sh, 0, sh.length); byte[] sg = pk7.getEncodedPKCS7(hash, cal); </pre></p></p><pre>public byte[] getAuthenticatedAttributeBytes(byte[] secondDigest, byte[] ocsp, Collection&lt;byte[]&gt; crlBytes, PdfSigner.CryptoStandard sigtype)</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/signatures/PdfPKCS7.html#getAuthenticatedAttributeBytes-byte:A-byte:A-java.util.Collection-com.itextpdf.signatures.PdfSigner.CryptoStandard-

PdfRendition flush	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>To manually flush a <code>PdfObject</code> behind this wrapper, you have to ensure that this object is added to the document, i.e. it has an indirect reference. Basically this means that before flushing you need to explicitly call <code>PdfObjectWrapper.makeIndirect(PdfDocument)</code>. For example: wrapperInstance.makeIndirect(document).flush(); Note that not every wrapper require this, only those that have such warning in documentation.<pre>public void flush()</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/action/PdfRendition.html#flush--
PdfRendition isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Defines if the object behind this wrapper must be an indirect object in the resultant document. <br><br> If this method returns <i>true</i> it doesn't necessarily mean that object must be in the indirect state at any moment, but rather defines that when the object will be written to the document it will be transformed into indirect object if it's not indirect yet. <br><br> Return value of this method shouldn't depend on any logic, it should return always <i>true</i> or <i>false</i>.</br></br></br></br><pre>protected boolean isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect()</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/action/PdfRendition.html#isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect--

PdfShading.CoonsPatchMesh	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The class that extends PdfShading class and is in charge of Shading Dictionary with Coons Patch mesh type. This type of shading is constructed from one or more colour patches, each bounded by four cubic BÃ©zier curves. Degenerate BÃ©zier curves are allowed and are useful for certain graphical effects. At least one complete patch shall be specified. The shape of patch is defined by 12 control points. Colours are specified for each corner of the unit square, and bilinear interpolation is used to fill in colours over the entire unit square. Coordinates are mapped from the unit square into a four-sided patch whose sides are not necessarily linear. The mapping is continuous: the corners of the unit square map to corners of the patch and the sides of the unit square map to sides of the patch. For the format of data stream, that defines patches Table 85. If the shading dictionary contains a Function entry, the colour data for each corner of a patch shall be specified by a single parametric value t rather than by n separate colour components c1â¦cn.</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/colorspace/PdfShading.CoonsPatchMesh.html

PdfShading.FreeFormGouraudShadedTriangleMesh	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The class that extends PdfShading class and is in charge of Shading Dictionary with free-form Gouraud-shaded triangle mesh type. The area to be shaded is defined by a path composed entirely of triangles. The colour at each vertex of the triangles is specified, and a technique known as Gouraud interpolation is used to colour the interiors. The object shall be represented as stream containing a sequence of vertex data. Each vertex is specified by the following values, in the order shown: f x y c1 â¦ cn where: f -  the vertexâs edge flag, that determines the vertex is connected to other vertices of the triangle mesh.      For full description Paragph 8.7.4.5.5 x, y - vertexâs horizontal and vertical coordinates, expressed in the shadingâs target coordinate space. c1â¦cn - vertexâs colour components. If the shading dictionary includes a Function entry, only a single parametric value, t, shall be specified for each vertex in place of the colour components c1â¦cn.</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/colorspace/PdfShading.FreeFormGouraudShadedTriangleMesh.html

PdfShading flush	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>To manually flush a <code>PdfObject</code> behind this wrapper, you have to ensure that this object is added to the document, i.e. it has an indirect reference. Basically this means that before flushing you need to explicitly call <code>PdfObjectWrapper.makeIndirect(PdfDocument)</code>. For example: wrapperInstance.makeIndirect(document).flush(); Note that not every wrapper require this, only those that have such warning in documentation.<pre>public void flush()</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/colorspace/PdfShading.html#flush--
PdfShading isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><b class="descfrmTypeLabel">Description copied from class:&nbsp;<code>PdfObjectWrapper</code></b><br>Defines if the object behind this wrapper must be an indirect object in the resultant document. <br><br> If this method returns <i>true</i> it doesn't necessarily mean that object must be in the indirect state at any moment, but rather defines that when the object will be written to the document it will be transformed into indirect object if it's not indirect yet. <br><br> Return value of this method shouldn't depend on any logic, it should return always <i>true</i> or <i>false</i>.</br></br></br></br><pre>protected boolean isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect()</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/colorspace/PdfShading.html#isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect--
PdfShading.LatticeFormGouraudShadedTriangleMesh	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The class that extends PdfShading class and is in charge of Shading Dictionary with lattice-form Gouraud-shaded triangle mesh type. This type is similar to PdfShading.FreeFormGouraudShadedTriangleMesh but instead of using free-form geometry, the vertices are arranged in a pseudorectangular lattice, which is topologically equivalent to a rectangular grid. The vertices are organized into rows, which need not be geometrically linear. The verticals data in stream is similar to PdfShading.FreeFormGouraudShadedTriangleMesh, except there is no edge flag.</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/colorspace/PdfShading.LatticeFormGouraudShadedTriangleMesh.html

PdfSigFieldLockDictionary isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><b class="descfrmTypeLabel">Description copied from class:&nbsp;<code>PdfObjectWrapper</code></b><br>Defines if the object behind this wrapper must be an indirect object in the resultant document. <br><br> If this method returns <i>true</i> it doesn't necessarily mean that object must be in the indirect state at any moment, but rather defines that when the object will be written to the document it will be transformed into indirect object if it's not indirect yet. <br><br> Return value of this method shouldn't depend on any logic, it should return always <i>true</i> or <i>false</i>.</br></br></br></br><pre>protected boolean isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect()</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/forms/PdfSigFieldLockDictionary.html#isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect--

PdfSigFieldLockDictionary.LockPermissions	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Enumerates the different levels of access permissions granted for the document when the corresponding signature field is signed: NO_CHANGES_ALLOWED - no changes to the document are     permitted; any change to the document invalidates the signature,FORM_FILLING - permitted changes are filling in forms,     instantiating page templates, and signing; other changes invalidate     the signature,FORM_FILLING_AND_ANNOTATION - permitted changes are the     same as for the previous, as well as annotation creation, deletion,     and modification; other changes invalidate the signature.</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/forms/PdfSigFieldLockDictionary.LockPermissions.html

PdfSignatureAppearance setImageScale	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Sets the scaling to be applied to the background image. If it's zero the image will fully fill the rectangle. If it's less than zero the image will fill the rectangle but will keep the proportions. If it's greater than zero that scaling will be applied. In any of the cases the image will always be centered. PdfSignatureBuildProperties isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><b class="descfrmTypeLabel">Description copied from class:&nbsp;<code>PdfObjectWrapper</code></b><br>Defines if the object behind this wrapper must be an indirect object in the resultant document. <br><br> If this method returns <i>true</i> it doesn't necessarily mean that object must be in the indirect state at any moment, but rather defines that when the object will be written to the document it will be transformed into indirect object if it's not indirect yet. <br><br> Return value of this method shouldn't depend on any logic, it should return always <i>true</i> or <i>false</i>.</br></br></br></br><pre>protected boolean isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect()</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/signatures/PdfSignatureBuildProperties.html#isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect--

PdfSigner getSignatureAppearance	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Provides access to a signature appearance object. Use it to customize the appearance of the signature. <p> Be aware: <ul><li>If you create new signature field (either use <code>setFieldName(java.lang.String)</code> with the name that doesn't exist in the document or don't specify it at all) then the signature is invisible by default.</li><li>If you sign already existing field, then the signature appearance object is modified to have all the properties (page num., rect etc.) consistent with the state of the field (<strong>if you customized the appearance object before the <code>setFieldName(java.lang.String)</code> call you'll have to do it again</strong>)</li></ul></p><pre>public PdfSignatureAppearance getSignatureAppearance()</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/signatures/PdfSigner.html#getSignatureAppearance--

PdfSpecialCs flush	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>To manually flush a <code>PdfObject</code> behind this wrapper, you have to ensure that this object is added to the document, i.e. it has an indirect reference. Basically this means that before flushing you need to explicitly call <code>PdfObjectWrapper.makeIndirect(PdfDocument)</code>. For example: wrapperInstance.makeIndirect(document).flush(); Note that not every wrapper require this, only those that have such warning in documentation.<pre>public void flush()</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/colorspace/PdfSpecialCs.html#flush--
PdfSpecialCs isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><b class="descfrmTypeLabel">Description copied from class:&nbsp;<code>PdfObjectWrapper</code></b><br>Defines if the object behind this wrapper must be an indirect object in the resultant document. <br><br> If this method returns <i>true</i> it doesn't necessarily mean that object must be in the indirect state at any moment, but rather defines that when the object will be written to the document it will be transformed into indirect object if it's not indirect yet. <br><br> Return value of this method shouldn't depend on any logic, it should return always <i>true</i> or <i>false</i>.</br></br></br></br><pre>protected boolean isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect()</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/colorspace/PdfSpecialCs.html#isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect--

PdfString	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>A PdfString-class is the PDF-equivalent of a JAVA-String-object.  A string is a sequence of characters delimited by parenthesis. If a string is too long to be conveniently placed on a single line, it may be split across multiple lines by using the backslash character (\) at the end of a line to indicate that the string continues on the following line. Within a string, the backslash character is used as an escape to specify unbalanced parenthesis, non-printing ASCII characters, and the backslash character itself. Use of the \ddd escape sequence is the preferred way to represent characters outside the printable ASCII character set. This object is described in the 'Portable Document Format Reference Manual version 1.7' section 3.2.3 (page 53-56). PdfObject</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfString.html

PdfStringDestination isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><b class="descfrmTypeLabel">Description copied from class:&nbsp;<code>PdfObjectWrapper</code></b><br>Defines if the object behind this wrapper must be an indirect object in the resultant document. <br><br> If this method returns <i>true</i> it doesn't necessarily mean that object must be in the indirect state at any moment, but rather defines that when the object will be written to the document it will be transformed into indirect object if it's not indirect yet. <br><br> Return value of this method shouldn't depend on any logic, it should return always <i>true</i> or <i>false</i>.</br></br></br></br><pre>protected boolean isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect()</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/navigation/PdfStringDestination.html#isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect--

PdfTextArray	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>PdfTextArray defines an array with displacements and PdfString-objects.  A PdfTextArray is used with the operator TJ in PdfCanvas. The first object in this array has to be a PdfString; see reference manual version 1.3 section 8.7.5, pages 346-347.       OR see reference manual version 1.6 section 5.3.2, pages 378-379. To emit a more efficient array, we consolidate repeated numbers or strings into single array entries. "add( 50 ); add( -50 );" will REMOVE the combined zero from the array.</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfTextArray.html

PdfTextMarkupAnnotation createHighLight	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Creates a text markup annotation of highlight style subtype. <p> IMPORTANT NOTE on <b>quadPoints</b> argument: According to Table 179 in ISO 32000-1, the QuadPoints array lists the vertices in counterclockwise order and the text orientation is defined by the first and second vertex. This basically means QuadPoints is specified as lower-left, lower-right, top-right, top-left. HOWEVER, Adobe's interpretation (tested at least with Acrobat 10, Acrobat 11, Reader 11) is top-left, top-right, lower-left, lower-right (Z-shaped order). This means that if the QuadPoints array is specified according to the standard, the rendering is not as expected. Other viewers seem to follow Adobe's interpretation. Hence we recommend to use and expect QuadPoints array in Z-order, just as Acrobat and probably most other viewers expect.</p><pre>public static PdfTextMarkupAnnotation createHighLight(Rectangle rect, float[] quadPoints)</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfTextMarkupAnnotation.html#createHighLight-com.itextpdf.kernel.geom.Rectangle-float:A-

This basically means QuadPoints is specified as lower-left, lower-right, top-right, top-left. HOWEVER, Adobe's interpretation (tested at least with Acrobat 10, Acrobat 11, Reader 11) is top-left, top-right, lower-left, lower-right (Z-shaped order). This means that if the QuadPoints array is specified according to the standard, the rendering is not as expected. Other viewers seem to follow Adobe's interpretation. Hence we recommend to use and expect QuadPoints array in Z-order, just as Acrobat and probably most other viewers expect.</p><pre>public static PdfTextMarkupAnnotation createUnderline(Rectangle rect, float[] quadPoints)</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/annot/PdfTextMarkupAnnotation.html#createUnderline-com.itextpdf.kernel.geom.Rectangle-float:A-

PdfTransparencyGroup isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><b class="descfrmTypeLabel">Description copied from class:&nbsp;<code>PdfObjectWrapper</code></b><br>Defines if the object behind this wrapper must be an indirect object in the resultant document. <br><br> If this method returns <i>true</i> it doesn't necessarily mean that object must be in the indirect state at any moment, but rather defines that when the object will be written to the document it will be transformed into indirect object if it's not indirect yet. <br><br> Return value of this method shouldn't depend on any logic, it should return always <i>true</i> or <i>false</i>.</br></br></br></br><pre>protected boolean isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect()</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/xobject/PdfTransparencyGroup.html#isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect--

PdfType3Font	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Low-level API class for Type 3 fonts.  In Type 3 fonts, glyphs are defined by streams of PDF graphics operators. These streams are associated with character names. A separate encoding entry maps character codes to the appropriate character names for the glyphs.  To be able to be wrapped with this PdfObjectWrapper the PdfObject must be indirect.</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/font/PdfType3Font.html

PdfViewerPreferences isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><b class="descfrmTypeLabel">Description copied from class:&nbsp;<code>PdfObjectWrapper</code></b><br>Defines if the object behind this wrapper must be an indirect object in the resultant document. <br><br> If this method returns <i>true</i> it doesn't necessarily mean that object must be in the indirect state at any moment, but rather defines that when the object will be written to the document it will be transformed into indirect object if it's not indirect yet. <br><br> Return value of this method shouldn't depend on any logic, it should return always <i>true</i> or <i>false</i>.</br></br></br></br><pre>protected boolean isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect()</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/PdfViewerPreferences.html#isWrappedObjectMustBeIndirect--

RandomAccessFileOrArray readShortLE	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Reads a signed 16-bit number from this stream in little-endian order. The method reads two bytes from this stream, starting at the current stream pointer. If the two bytes read, in order, are <code>b1</code> and <code>b2</code>, where each of the two values is between <code>0</code> and <code>255</code>, inclusive, then the result is equal to: <blockquote><pre>     (short)((b2 &lt;&lt; 8) | b1) </pre></blockquote><p> This method blocks until the two bytes are read, the end of the stream is detected, or an exception is thrown.</p><pre>public final short readShortLE() throws IOException</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/io/source/RandomAccessFileOrArray.html#readShortLE--

RandomAccessFileOrArray readUnsignedShortLE	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Reads an unsigned 16-bit number from this stream in little-endian order. This method reads two bytes from the stream, starting at the current stream pointer. If the bytes read, in order, are <code>b1</code> and <code>b2</code>, where <code>0 &lt;= b1, b2 &lt;= 255</code>, then the result is equal to: <blockquote><pre>     (b2 &lt;&lt; 8) | b1 </pre></blockquote><p> This method blocks until the two bytes are read, the end of the stream is detected, or an exception is thrown.</p><pre>public final int readUnsignedShortLE() throws IOException</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/io/source/RandomAccessFileOrArray.html#readUnsignedShortLE--

RandomAccessFileOrArray readCharLE	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Reads a Unicode character from this stream in little-endian order. This method reads two bytes from the stream, starting at the current stream pointer. If the bytes read, in order, are <code>b1</code> and <code>b2</code>, where <code>0 &lt;= b1, b2 &lt;= 255</code>, then the result is equal to: <blockquote><pre>     (char)((b2 &lt;&lt; 8) | b1) </pre></blockquote><p> This method blocks until the two bytes are read, the end of the stream is detected, or an exception is thrown.</p><pre>public final char readCharLE() throws IOException</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/io/source/RandomAccessFileOrArray.html#readCharLE--
RandomAccessFileOrArray readInt	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><pre>public int readInt() throws IOException</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/io/source/RandomAccessFileOrArray.html#readInt--
RandomAccessFileOrArray readIntLE	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Reads a signed 32-bit integer from this stream in little-endian order. This method reads 4 bytes from the stream, starting at the current stream pointer. If the bytes read, in order, are <code>b1</code>, <code>b2</code>, <code>b3</code>, and <code>b4</code>, where <code>0 &lt;= b1, b2, b3, b4 &lt;= 255</code>, then the result is equal to: <blockquote><pre>     (b4 &lt;&lt; 24) | (b3 &lt;&lt; 16) + (b2 &lt;&lt; 8) + b1 </pre></blockquote><p> This method blocks until the four bytes are read, the end of the stream is detected, or an exception is thrown.</p><pre>public final int readIntLE() throws IOException</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/io/source/RandomAccessFileOrArray.html#readIntLE--
RandomAccessFileOrArray readUnsignedInt	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Reads an unsigned 32-bit integer from this stream. This method reads 4 bytes from the stream, starting at the current stream pointer. If the bytes read, in order, are <code>b1</code>, <code>b2</code>, <code>b3</code>, and <code>b4</code>, where <code>0 &lt;= b1, b2, b3, b4 &lt;= 255</code>, then the result is equal to: <blockquote><pre>     (b1 &lt;&lt; 24) | (b2 &lt;&lt; 16) + (b3 &lt;&lt; 8) + b4 </pre></blockquote><p> This method blocks until the four bytes are read, the end of the stream is detected, or an exception is thrown.</p><pre>public final long readUnsignedInt() throws IOException</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/io/source/RandomAccessFileOrArray.html#readUnsignedInt--

RandomAccessSourceFactory createBestSource	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Creates a <code>IRandomAccessSource</code> based on a filename string. If the filename describes a URL, a URL based source is created If the filename describes a file on disk, the contents may be read into memory (if <code>forceRead</code> is true), opened using memory mapped file channel (if usePlainRandomAccess is false), or opened using <code>RandomAccessFile</code> access (if usePlainRandomAccess is true) This call will automatically fail over to using <code>RandomAccessFile</code> if the memory map operation fails<pre>public IRandomAccessSource createBestSource(String filename) throws IOException</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/io/source/RandomAccessSourceFactory.html#createBestSource-java.lang.String-

RootRenderer layout	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>This method simulates positioning of the renderer, including all of its children, and returns the <code>LayoutResult</code>, representing the layout result, including occupied area, status, i.e. if there was enough place to fit the renderer subtree, etc. <code>LayoutResult</code> can be extended to return custom layout results for custom elements, e.g. <code>TextRenderer</code> uses <code>TextLayoutResult</code> as its result. This method can be called standalone to learn how much area the renderer subtree needs, or can be called before <code>IRenderer.draw(DrawContext)</code>, to prepare the renderer to be flushed to the output stream.<pre>public LayoutResult layout(LayoutContext layoutContext)</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/renderer/RootRenderer.html#layout-com.itextpdf.layout.layout.LayoutContext-

RoundDotsBorder draw	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><p> All borders are supposed to be drawn in such way, that inner content of the element is on the right from the drawing direction. Borders are drawn in this order: top, right, bottom, left. </p><p> Given points specify the line which lies on the border of the content area, therefore the border itself should be drawn to the left from the drawing direction. </p><p><code>borderWidthBefore</code> and <code>borderWidthAfter</code> parameters are used to define the widths of the borders that are before and after the current border, e.g. for the bottom border, <code>borderWidthBefore</code> specifies width of the right border and <code>borderWidthAfter</code> - width of the left border. Those width are used to handle areas of border joins. </p><pre>public void draw(PdfCanvas canvas, float x1, float y1, float x2, float y2, float borderWidthBefore, float borderWidthAfter)</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/border/RoundDotsBorder.html#draw-com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.canvas.PdfCanvas-float-float-float-float-float-float-

Table isComplete	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><b class="descfrmTypeLabel">Description copied from interface:&nbsp;<code>ILargeElement</code></b><br>Checks whether an element has already been marked as complete.<pre>public boolean isComplete()</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/element/Table.html#isComplete--
Table complete	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Indicates that all the desired content has been added to this large element. After this method is called, more precise rendering is activated. For instance, a table may have a <code>setSkipLastFooter(boolean)</code> method set to true, and in case of large table on <code>flush()</code> we do not know if any more content will be added, so we might not place the content in the bottom of the page where it would fit, but instead add a footer, and place that content in the start of the page. Technically such result would look all right, but it would be more concise if we placed the content in the bottom and did not start new page. For such cases to be renderered more accurately, one can call <code>complete()</code> when some content is still there and not flushed.<pre>public void complete()</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/element/Table.html#complete--
Table flush	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Writes the newly added content to the document.<pre>public void flush()</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/element/Table.html#flush--

This is a method for internal usage and is called automatically by the docunent.<pre>public void flushContent()</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/element/Table.html#flushContent--

TableRenderer layout	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>This method simulates positioning of the renderer, including all of its children, and returns the <code>LayoutResult</code>, representing the layout result, including occupied area, status, i.e. if there was enough place to fit the renderer subtree, etc. <code>LayoutResult</code> can be extended to return custom layout results for custom elements, e.g. <code>TextRenderer</code> uses <code>TextLayoutResult</code> as its result. This method can be called standalone to learn how much area the renderer subtree needs, or can be called before <code>IRenderer.draw(DrawContext)</code>, to prepare the renderer to be flushed to the output stream.<pre>public LayoutResult layout(LayoutContext layoutContext)</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/renderer/TableRenderer.html#layout-com.itextpdf.layout.layout.LayoutContext-

TagStructureContext	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>TagStructureContext class is used to track necessary information of document's tag structure. It is also used to make some global modifications of the tag tree like removing or flushing page tags, however these two methods and also others are called automatically and are for the most part for internal usage.  There shall be only one instance of this class per PdfDocument. To obtain instance of this class use PdfDocument.getTagStructureContext().</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/tagutils/TagStructureContext.html

TagStructureContext flushPageTags	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Flushes the tags which are considered to belong to the given page. The logic that defines if the given tag (structure element) belongs to the page is the following: if all the marked content references (dictionary or number references), that are the descenders of the given structure element, belong to the current page - the tag is considered to belong to the page. If tag has descenders from several pages - it is flushed, if all other pages except the current one are flushed. <br><br> If some of the page's tags are still connected to the accessible elements, in this case these tags are considered as not yet finished ones, and they won't be flushed.</br></br><pre>public TagStructureContext flushPageTags(PdfPage page)</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/tagutils/TagStructureContext.html#flushPageTags-com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.PdfPage-
TagStructureContext normalizeDocumentRootTag	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Transforms root tags in a way that complies with the PDF References. <br/><br/> PDF Reference 10.7.3 Grouping Elements: <br/><br/> For most content extraction formats, the document must be a tree with a single top-level element; the structure tree root (identified by the StructTreeRoot entry in the document catalog) must have only one child in its K (kids) array. If the PDF file contains a complete document, the structure type Document is recommended for this top-level element in the logical structure hierarchy. If the file contains a well-formed document fragment, one of the structure types Part, Art, Sect, or Div may be used instead.<pre>public void normalizeDocumentRootTag()</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/tagutils/TagStructureContext.html#normalizeDocumentRootTag--
TagStructureContext actualizeTagsProperties	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Method for internal usages. Essentially, all it does is just making sure that for connected tags properties are up to date with connected accessible elements properties.<pre>public void actualizeTagsProperties()</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/tagutils/TagStructureContext.html#actualizeTagsProperties--
TagTreePointer	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>TagTreePointer class is used to modify the document's tag tree. At any given moment, instance of this class 'points' at the specific position in the tree (at the specific tag). For the current tag you can add new tags, modify it's role and properties, etc. Also, using instance of this class, you can change tag position in the tag structure, you can flush current tag or remove it.  There could be any number of the instances of this class, simultaneously pointing to different (or the same) parts of the tag structure. Because of this, you can for example remove the tag at which another instance is currently pointing. In this case, this another instance becomes invalid, and invocation of any method on it will result in exception. To make given instance valid again, use moveToRoot() method.</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/tagutils/TagTreePointer.html
TagTreePointer setPageForTagging	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Sets a page which content will be tagged with this instance of <code>TagTreePointer</code>. To tag page content: <ol><li>Set pointer position to the tag which will be the parent of the page content item;</li><li>Call <code>getTagReference()</code> to obtain the reference to the current tag;</li><li>Pass <code>PdfTagReference</code> to the <code>PdfCanvas.openTag(TagReference)</code> method of the page's <code>PdfCanvas</code> to start marked content item;</li><li>Draw content on <code>PdfCanvas</code>;</li><li>Use <code>PdfCanvas.closeTag()</code> to finish marked content item.</li></ol><pre>public TagTreePointer setPageForTagging(PdfPage page)</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/tagutils/TagTreePointer.html#setPageForTagging-com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.PdfPage-

TagTreePointer setContentStreamForTagging	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Sometimes, tags are desired to be connected with the content that resides not in the page's content stream, but rather in the some appearance stream or in the form xObject stream. In that case, to have a valid tag structure, one shall set not only the page, on which the content will be rendered, but also the content stream in which the tagged content will reside. <br><br> NOTE: It's important to set a <code>null</code> for this value, when tagging of this stream content is finished.</br></br><pre>public TagTreePointer setContentStreamForTagging(PdfStream contentStream)</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/tagutils/TagTreePointer.html#setContentStreamForTagging-com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.PdfStream-

TagTreePointer addTag	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Adds a new tag to the tag structure. This method call moves this <code>TagTreePointer</code> to the added kid. <br/> New tag will have a role and attributes defined by the given IAccessibleElement. <br><br> If  is true then a newly created tag will retain the connection with given accessible element. See <code>moveToTag(com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.tagutils.IAccessibleElement)</code> for more explanations about tag connections concept. <br/><br/> If the same accessible element is connected to the tag and is added twice to the same parent - this <code>TagTreePointer</code> instance would move to connected kid instead of creating tag twice. But if it is added to some other parent, then connection will be removed. <p><br/><br/> This call is equivalent of calling sequentially <code>setNextNewKidIndex(int)</code> and <code>addTag(IAccessibleElement, boolean)</code>.</p></br></br><pre>public TagTreePointer addTag(int index, IAccessibleElement element, boolean keepConnectedToTag)</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/tagutils/TagTreePointer.html#addTag-int-com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.tagutils.IAccessibleElement-boolean-

If you want to add annotation tag manually, be sure to use <code>PdfPage.addAnnotation(int, PdfAnnotation, boolean)</code> method with <i>false</i> for boolean flag.<pre>public TagTreePointer addAnnotationTag(PdfAnnotation annotation)</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/tagutils/TagTreePointer.html#addAnnotationTag-com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.annot.PdfAnnotation-
TagTreePointer setNextNewKidIndex	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Sets index of the next added to the current tag kid, which could be another tag or content item. By default, new tag is added at the end of the parent kids array. This property affects only the next added tag, all tags added after will be added with the default behaviour. <br/><br/> This method could be used with any overload of <code>addTag(PdfName)</code> method, with <code>relocateKid(int, TagTreePointer)</code> and <code>addAnnotationTag(PdfAnnotation)</code>. <br/> Keep in mind, that this method set property to the <code>TagTreePointer</code> and not to the tag itself, which means that if you would move the pointer, this property would be applied to the new current tag.<pre>public TagTreePointer setNextNewKidIndex(int nextNewKidIndex)</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/tagutils/TagTreePointer.html#setNextNewKidIndex-int-

TagTreePointer removeTag	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Removes the current tag. If it has kids, they will become kids of the current tag parent. This method call moves this <code>TagTreePointer</code> to the current tag parent. <br/><br/> You cannot remove root tag, and also you cannot remove any tag if document's tag structure was partially flushed; in this two cases an exception will be thrown.<pre>public TagTreePointer removeTag()</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/tagutils/TagTreePointer.html#removeTag--

TagTreePointer moveToTag	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Moves this <code>TagTreePointer</code> instance to a tag, which is connected with the given accessible element. <p><br/><br/> The connection between the tag and the accessible element instance is used as a sign that tag is not yet finished and therefore should not be flushed or removed if page tags are flushed or removed. Also, any <code>TagTreePointer</code> could be immediately moved to the tag with connection via it's connected element by using this method. If accessible element is connected to the tag, then all changes of the role or properties of the element will affect the connected tag role and properties. <br/> For any existing not connected tag the connection could be created using <code>getConnectedElement(boolean)</code> with <i>true</i> as parameter.</p><pre>public TagTreePointer moveToTag(IAccessibleElement element)</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/tagutils/TagTreePointer.html#moveToTag-com.itextpdf.kernel.pdf.tagutils.IAccessibleElement-

TagTreePointer flushTag	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Flushes the current tag and all it's descenders. This method call moves this <code>TagTreePointer</code> to the current tag parent. <p><br><br> If some of the tags to be flushed are still connected to the accessible elements, then these tags are considered as not yet finished ones, and they won't be flushed immediately, but they will be flushed, when the connection is removed.</br></br></p><pre>public TagTreePointer flushTag()</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/tagutils/TagTreePointer.html#flushTag--

TernaryTree	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Ternary Search Tree.A ternary search tree is a hibrid between a binary tree and a digital search tree (trie). Keys are limited to strings. A data value of type char is stored in each leaf node. It can be used as an index (or pointer) to the data. Branches that only contain one key are compressed to one node by storing a pointer to the trailer substring of the key. This class is intended to serve as base class or helper class to implement Dictionary collections or the like. Ternary trees have some nice properties as the following: the tree can be traversed in sorted order, partial matches (wildcard) can be implemented, retrieval of all keys within a given distance from the target, etc. The storage requirements are higher than a binary tree but a lot less than a trie. Performance is comparable with a hash table, sometimes it outperforms a hash function (most of the time can determine a miss faster than a hash).The main purpose of this java port is to serve as a base for implementing TeX's hyphenation algorithm (see The TeXBook, appendix H). Each language requires from 5000 to 15000 hyphenation patterns which will be keys in this tree. The strings patterns are usually small (from 2 to 5 characters), but each char in the tree is stored in a node. Thus memory usage is the main concern. We will sacrify 'elegance' to keep memory requirements to the minimum. Using java's char type as pointer (yes, I know pointer it is a forbidden word in java) we can keep the size of the node to be just 8 bytes (3 pointers and the data char). This gives room for about 65000 nodes. In my tests the english patterns took 7694 nodes and the german patterns 10055 nodes, so I think we are safe.All said, this is a map with strings as keys and char as value. Pretty limited!. It can be extended to a general map by using the string representation of an object and using the char value as an index to an array that contains the object values.This work was authored by Carlos Villegas (cav@uniscope.co.jp).</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/hyphenation/TernaryTree.html
TernaryTree init	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>initialize<pre>protected void init()</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/hyphenation/TernaryTree.html#init--
TernaryTree insert	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Branches are initially compressed, needing one node per key plus the size of the string key. They are decompressed as needed when another key with same prefix is inserted. This saves a lot of space, specially for long keys.<pre>public void insert(String key, char val)</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/hyphenation/TernaryTree.html#insert-java.lang.String-char-

TernaryTree trimToSize	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Each node stores a character (splitchar) which is part of some key(s). In a compressed branch (one that only contain a single string key) the trailer of the key which is not already in nodes is stored  externally in the kv array. As items are inserted, key substrings decrease. Some substrings may completely  disappear when the whole branch is totally decompressed. The tree is traversed to find the key substrings actually used. In addition, duplicate substrings are removed using a map (implemented with a TernaryTree!).<pre>public void trimToSize()</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/layout/hyphenation/TernaryTree.html#trimToSize--

TIFFConstants	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>A list of constants used in class TIFFImage.</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/io/codec/TIFFConstants.html
TIFFDirectory	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>A class representing an Image File Directory (IFD) from a TIFF 6.0 stream.  The TIFF file format is described in more detail in the comments for the TIFFDescriptor class.  A TIFF IFD consists of a set of TIFFField tags.  Methods are provided to query the set of tags and to obtain the raw field array.  In addition, convenience methods are provided for acquiring the values of tags that contain a single value that fits into a byte, int, long, float, or double.  Every TIFF file is made up of one or more public IFDs that are joined in a linked list, rooted in the file header.  A file may also contain so-called private IFDs that are referenced from tag data and do not appear in the main list.  This class is not a committed part of the JAI API.  It may be removed or changed in future releases of JAI.</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/io/codec/TIFFDirectory.html

TIFFField	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>A class representing a field in a TIFF 6.0 Image File Directory.  The TIFF file format is described in more detail in the comments for the TIFFDescriptor class.  A field in a TIFF Image File Directory (IFD).  A field is defined as a sequence of values of identical data type.  TIFF 6.0 defines 12 data types, which are mapped internally onto the Java data types byte, int, long, float, and double.  This class is not a committed part of the JAI API.  It may be removed or changed in future releases of JAI.</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/io/codec/TIFFField.html
TIFFField getTag	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Returns the tag number, between 0 and 65535.<pre>public int getTag()</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/io/codec/TIFFField.html#getTag--
TIFFField getType	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Returns the type of the data stored in the IFD. For a TIFF6.0 file, the value will equal one of the TIFF_ constants defined in this class.  For future revisions of TIFF, higher values are possible.<pre>public int getType()</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/io/codec/TIFFField.html#getType--
TIFFField getCount	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Returns the number of elements in the IFD.<pre>public int getCount()</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/io/codec/TIFFField.html#getCount--
TIFFField getAsBytes	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Returns the data as an uninterpreted array of bytes. The type of the field must be one of TIFF_BYTE, TIFF_SBYTE, or TIFF_UNDEFINED; <p> For data in TIFF_BYTE format, the application must take care when promoting the data to longer integral types to avoid sign extension. <p> A ClassCastException will be thrown if the field is not of type TIFF_BYTE, TIFF_SBYTE, or TIFF_UNDEFINED.</p></p><pre>public byte[] getAsBytes()</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/io/codec/TIFFField.html#getAsBytes--
TIFFField getAsChars	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Returns TIFF_SHORT data as an array of chars (unsigned 16-bit integers). <p> A ClassCastException will be thrown if the field is not of type TIFF_SHORT.</p><pre>public char[] getAsChars()</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/io/codec/TIFFField.html#getAsChars--
TIFFField getAsShorts	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Returns TIFF_SSHORT data as an array of shorts (signed 16-bit integers). <p> A ClassCastException will be thrown if the field is not of type TIFF_SSHORT.</p><pre>public short[] getAsShorts()</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/io/codec/TIFFField.html#getAsShorts--
TIFFField getAsInts	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Returns TIFF_SLONG data as an array of ints (signed 32-bit integers). <p> A ClassCastException will be thrown if the field is not of type TIFF_SLONG.</p><pre>public int[] getAsInts()</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/io/codec/TIFFField.html#getAsInts--
TIFFField getAsLongs	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Returns TIFF_LONG data as an array of longs (signed 64-bit integers). <p> A ClassCastException will be thrown if the field is not of type TIFF_LONG.</p><pre>public long[] getAsLongs()</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/io/codec/TIFFField.html#getAsLongs--

TIFFField getAsInt	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Returns data in TIFF_BYTE, TIFF_SBYTE, TIFF_UNDEFINED, TIFF_SHORT, TIFF_SSHORT, or TIFF_SLONG format as an int. <p> TIFF_BYTE and TIFF_UNDEFINED data are treated as unsigned; that is, no sign extension will take place and the returned value will be in the range [0, 255].  TIFF_SBYTE data will be returned in the range [-128, 127]. <p> A ClassCastException will be thrown if the field is not of type TIFF_BYTE, TIFF_SBYTE, TIFF_UNDEFINED, TIFF_SHORT, TIFF_SSHORT, or TIFF_SLONG.</p></p><pre>public int getAsInt(int index)</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/io/codec/TIFFField.html#getAsInt-int-
TIFFField getAsLong	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Returns data in TIFF_BYTE, TIFF_SBYTE, TIFF_UNDEFINED, TIFF_SHORT, TIFF_SSHORT, TIFF_SLONG, or TIFF_LONG format as a long. <p> TIFF_BYTE and TIFF_UNDEFINED data are treated as unsigned; that is, no sign extension will take place and the returned value will be in the range [0, 255].  TIFF_SBYTE data will be returned in the range [-128, 127]. <p> A ClassCastException will be thrown if the field is not of type TIFF_BYTE, TIFF_SBYTE, TIFF_UNDEFINED, TIFF_SHORT, TIFF_SSHORT, TIFF_SLONG, or TIFF_LONG.</p></p><pre>public long getAsLong(int index)</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/io/codec/TIFFField.html#getAsLong-int-
TIFFField getAsFloat	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Returns data in any numerical format as a float.  Data in TIFF_SRATIONAL or TIFF_RATIONAL format are evaluated by dividing the numerator into the denominator using double-precision arithmetic and then truncating to single precision.  Data in TIFF_SLONG, TIFF_LONG, or TIFF_DOUBLE format may suffer from truncation. <p> A ClassCastException will be thrown if the field is of type TIFF_UNDEFINED or TIFF_ASCII.</p><pre>public float getAsFloat(int index)</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/io/codec/TIFFField.html#getAsFloat-int-

An array of one or more public certificates must be provided together with an array of the same size for the permissions for each certificate. The permissions can be combined by ORing them. Optionally DO_NOT_ENCRYPT_METADATA can be ored to output the metadata in cleartext See <code>EncryptionConstants</code>.<pre>public WriterProperties setPublicKeyEncryption(Certificate[] certs, int[] permissions, int encryptionAlgorithm)</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/pdf/WriterProperties.html#setPublicKeyEncryption-java.security.cert.Certificate:A-int:A-int-

XMPConst	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>Common constants for the XMP Toolkit.</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/xmp/XMPConst.html
XMPDateTime	A										<section class="prog__container"><p>The XMPDateTime-class represents a point in time up to a resolution of nano seconds. Dates and time in the serialized XMP are ISO 8601 strings. There are utility functions to convert to the ISO format, a Calendar or get the Timezone. The fields of XMPDateTime are:  month - The month in the range 1..12.  day - The day of the month in the range 1..31.  minute - The minute in the range 0..59.  hour - The time zone hour in the range 0..23.  minute - The time zone minute in the range 0..59.  nanoSecond - The nano seconds within a second. Note: if the XMPDateTime is converted into a calendar, the resolution is reduced to milli seconds.  timeZone - a TimeZone-object.  DateTime values are occasionally used in cases with only a date or only a time component. A date without a time has zeros for all the time fields. A time without a date has zeros for all date fields (year, month, and day).</p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/xmp/XMPDateTime.html
XMPDateTime getYear	A										<section class="prog__container"><p><pre>int getYear()</pre></p></section>	http://itextsupport.com/apidocs/itext7/7.0.1/com/itextpdf/kernel/xmp/XMPDateTime.html#getYear--
